name: Congenital Pyloric Stenosis with Secondary Dehydration
chief_complaint: My baby keeps vomiting after every feed and seems very tired
prognosis: Excellent with timely surgical intervention, full recovery expected
description: A condition where the pyloric muscle thickens, causing gastric outlet obstruction in infants. Typically presents at 3-6 weeks of age with progressive non-bilious vomiting leading to dehydration and electrolyte imbalances.
multiple_choice: Congenital Pyloric Stenosis with Secondary Dehydration
